title: does anyone else think the match making is broken
body:
i play with my girlfriend maybe 5 or 6 times a week and sometimes with my brother aswell, we have all recently hit level 30
i have 94 wins my girlfriend has 70 and my brother has around 100 
at the end of every game we play i check the wins of our team vs theres and not once ever have the numbers been close
our last game we worked out that there team had 1000 wins more than mine and the game before that there was not 1 player with wins below 240 
why are we getting put up against people with triple the amount of in game experience and triple our wins not to mention none of us are ranked but every game we play were always against ranked players, on several occasions we have ended up against gold ranked 700 wins 
its getting boring now going up against people who know everything about the game with 700 wins when the two of us combined is under 200
does anybody else feel this needs looking at ?

replies.body: because normals. just because they have more wins doesn't mean that they're better than you.

All I can say is that more wins doesn't equal better player. 
I have seen someone with over 3000 ranked games still in Bronze 5.
Take it as a compliment, you are playing well and you will get even better by playing against better people

I complained about the same thing on the forums a while ago.

Level 29 I facerolled everyone, game was too easy.

Level 30 I got trashed hard every game, game was too hard.

It sucked. There was no smooth transition.

The only positive thing to take away from the experience is that you will **never** improve facing bad players. You will only improve facing people who are better than you.

It's a part of the learning curve.

It's a *horribly* jagged curve.

But that's League.

Enjoy.
I made a smurf yesterday. I got it to level 3 for PVP. Went in with a pre made 5. Plat 5 vs level 3. We lost but I had the best end game KDA on my team.

Something you have to realise about playing League on the Oceania server is that there just isn't the same number of people here as there are on other servers such as NA and EU. As such, the lower playerbase results in having less people for the matchmaking system to work with, and this can sometimes result in the skewed teams that you play with. I understand it can be frustrating to play against people who are much better than you, but there's always going to be someone in your match that is the "best" of everyone there....although I do agree that if that skill differential is massive it can be demoralising. :(

pretty much what he said, you just have to take in to account that due to our low player base if we didnt match-make the way we do we would have to wait up to 15 mins for games sometimes

a good comparison for you to wrap your head around, California has more players than the oce community combined lol.

Look, i've said it before and i'll say it again, i've said it before. :)

Nah but seriously now, i'm pretty sure the people you play in normals has to do with the same kinda thing as ranked, if you win more than you lose you'll be placed against better players, vice versa. :)

Hm, seems strange. Only thing I can think of is that the system is pushing your rating higher since you went in as pre-made, while your other team might be full of higher ranked solo'ers to compensate.

There's also the thing where even though players may have lots of games won and experience, it will still match based upon their perceived rating/mmr. So its not too uncommon for people with lots of wins to be paired against more relative newcomers if your score to date has been favourable (since I don't think win #'s count at all in the matchmaking)
